main event: On January 29, 1954, a radar observation reported a red light that followed an aircraft near Cold Bay, Alaska.
interesting points: The red lights were observed with no clear detail, seemingly oscillating vertically, The object gradually faded from view after following the aircraft for two minutes, The sighting included observations from military air crew and was noted as possibly being a balloon or aircraft, The report concluded that there was insufficient data for a positive identification of the sighted object, Multiple reliable witnesses confirmed the sighting.
witness description: military air crew and other reliable witnesses
